title: EV sales are way down. Here’s why that might not be a big deal.
description:
According to the latest data, electric vehicle dealers sold about 20 percent fewer used electric cars in October than in September and saw a 50 percent drop for new ones. The question now is whether this dip is a sign of a prolonged slump or a mere blip in an otherwise upward trajectory.

While only time will tell, many analysts believe that electric vehicle adoption in the United States will continue to grow — albeit maybe not at the same pace seen before Congress killed the credits and automakers started second-guessing themselves.

Eliminating the federal credit of $7,500 on new EVs and $4,500 on used ones is certainly taking a toll. But the price of batteries, and thus cars, also continues to come down, and used models are becoming more of a bargain. Additionally, some states are trying to step in to fill the void the federal government has left.
